solution.text:
Sum\(=\)Rs. P
Time, T\(=_{j}_\) years
Rate of interest, R\(=_{k}_\)%
Difference between interest\(=\)Rs. \(_{{trunc(((((100+k)/Decimal(100))**j-((j*k)/(Decimal(100)))-1)*l),4)}}_\)
Thus,
Amount after compound interest \(-\) Amount after simple interest \(=\) Rs. \(_{{trunc(((((100+k)/Decimal(100))**j-((j*k)/(Decimal(100)))-1)*l),4)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow P\left(1+\frac{R}{100}\right)^T-\left(P+\frac{P \times R \times T}{100}\right)=_{{trunc(((((100+k)/Decimal(100))**j-((j*k)/(Decimal(100)))-1)*l),4)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow P \left[ \left(\frac{100+_{k}_}{100}\right)^_{j}_-1-\left(\frac{_{k}_ \times _{j}_}{100}\right)\right]=_{{trunc(((((100+k)/Decimal(100))**j-((j*k)/(Decimal(100)))-1)*l),4)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow P [_{{trunc((((100+k)/Decimal(100))**j-((j*k)/Decimal(100))-1),4)}}_]=_{{trunc(((((100+k)/Decimal(100))**j-((j*k)/(Decimal(100)))-1)*l),4)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow\) P\(=\frac{_{{trunc(((((100+k)/Decimal(100))**j-((j*k)/(Decimal(100)))-1)*l),4)}}_}{_{{trunc((((100+k)/Decimal(100))**j-((j*k)/Decimal(100))-1),4)}}_}=\) Rs. \(_{l}_\)

content.text: Tina's mother gives her a sum of money for her birthday and decides to put it into a bank for her. The bank offers two plans, a compound interest plan and a simple interest plan. Tina's mother tells her that the difference between the compound interest, compounded annually and the simple interest in the sum for \(_{j}_\) years at \(_{k}_\)% per annum is Rs.\(_{{trunc(((((100+k)/Decimal(100))**j-((j*k)/(Decimal(100)))-1)*l),4)}}_\). What is the sum?
